channel.title: Yet Another! | Beginner Photoshop Signature Tutorial | CS6 | Basix
channel.description:
[i]Hello Mopar! My last tutorial got good feed back, and that encouraged me to make yet another beginner Photoshop tutorial.[/i]
Difficulty: [b]1/10[/b]
Requirements: [ul][li][b]Ability to read![/b][/ul]
[ul][li][b]Any version of Photoshop[/b][/ul]
[center][size=36pt]Basix Signature Tutorial[/size][/center]
[I]Before we start you are going to need a couple things[/I]
[ul][li]A background which can be downloaded [url=http://i.imgur.com/ZqVh9uQ.png]here[/url][/li] [li]This font (Not required) which can be downloaded [url=http://up.ht/1pr4hu4]here[/url][/li][/ul]
[i]Note: To install the font simply open it and click install[/i]
Okay now that we have everything we need, let's get started. :)
[ul][li]First off we are going to create a new canvas [b](Ctrl+N)[/b] with the dimensions [b]647 Pixels x 199 Pixels[/b] and a resolution of [b]72 Pixels/Inch[/b][/ul]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/m2XhEY1.png[/img]
[ul][li]Second step is to open up the downloaded picture [b](Ctrl+O)[/b] and re-size it to your liking using the [b]Transform Tool (Ctrl+T)[/b]. Personally I like mine like this.[/ul]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/FVcTGQo.png[/img]
[ul][li]Next we want to insert a text with the desired font using the [b]Text Tool (T)[/b]. Use the [b]Transform Tool (Ctrl+T)[/b] to re-size the font, and place it where ever you like it. I personally like it just sitting on the top of the lens flare.[/ul]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/O2bplMv.png[/img]
[ul][li]Now that that is complete we are going to add an outer-glow to the text.[/li][/ul]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/hv3NRSZ.png[/img]
Change the outer-glow color to: #[b]061025[/b] and press OK [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/AII9bpY.png[/img]
[i]Next are the settings for the outer-glow I used in the picture are:[/i] [i]Spread - 0% Size - 9px[/i] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/rM7d47z.png[/img]
[ul][li]The next step is to [b]Rasterize[/b] the text. To do this right click the text layer and select Rasterize. This will allow us to make a few extra changes to it.[/ul]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Dlb0HmG.png[/img]
[ul][li]Now use the [b]Rectangular Marquee Tool (M)[/b] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/CVKvXdZ.png[/img] and highlight small parts that you want to change. Once highlighted use the [b]Transform Tool (Ctrl+T)[/b] then use the left and right arrow keys to the desired spot. I did this 3 times.[/ul]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/m8I2ECS.png[/img]
[i]The end result![/i] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/blPsMXA.jpg[/img]

Lil_Smok3r:

Nice tutorial man! Should be good for people who are new to graphics.

Thanks It’s not very informative though They may learn a few new hot keys I guess lol.

item.title: Yet Another! | Beginner Photoshop Signature Tutorial | CS6 | Basix
item.dc:creator: @Basix Basix
item.description:
@Basix wrote:

Hello Mopar! My last tutorial got good feed back, and that encouraged me to make yet another beginner Photoshop tutorial.

Difficulty: 1/10

Requirements:
[ul][li]Ability to read![/ul]

[ul][li]Any version of Photoshop[/ul]

[center][size=36pt]Basix Signature Tutorial[/size][/center]

[I]Before we start you are going to need a couple things[/I]

[ul][li]A background which can be downloaded here[/li]
[li]This font (Not required) which can be downloaded here[/li][/ul]

Note: To install the font simply open it and click install

Okay now that we have everything we need, let’s get started.

[ul][li]First off we are going to create a new canvas b[/b] with the dimensions 647 Pixels x 199 Pixels and a resolution of 72 Pixels/Inch[/ul]

[ul][li]Second step is to open up the downloaded picture b[/b] and re-size it to your liking using the Transform Tool (Ctrl+T). Personally I like mine like this.[/ul]

[ul][li]Next we want to insert a text with the desired font using the Text Tool (T). Use the Transform Tool (Ctrl+T) to re-size the font, and place it where ever you like it. I personally like it just sitting on the top of the lens flare.[/ul]

[ul][li]Now that that is complete we are going to add an outer-glow to the text.[/li][/ul]

Change the outer-glow color to: #061025 and press OK

Next are the settings for the outer-glow I used in the picture are:
Spread - 0%
Size - 9px

[ul][li]The next step is to Rasterize the text. To do this right click the text layer and select Rasterize. This will allow us to make a few extra changes to it.[/ul]

[ul][li]Now use the Rectangular Marquee Tool (M) and highlight small parts that you want to change. Once highlighted use the Transform Tool (Ctrl+T) then use the left and right arrow keys to the desired spot. I did this 3 times.[/ul]

The end result!

Read full topic
item.source: Yet Another! | Beginner Photoshop Signature Tutorial | CS6 | Basix
